summary: The "Caring for All Families Act" amends the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 and Title 5 of the United States Code. It expands the definition of family members for whom employees can take leave to include domestic partners, various in-laws, adult children, grandparents, grandchildren, siblings, and individuals with a close familial-like relationship. Additionally, it allows employees to take parental involvement and family wellness leave for school activities, medical appointments, and elderly care, with limitations on the amount of leave and notice requirements.
